Virtual Reality Task Simulation: Develop a virtual reality platform that simulates the tasks you're jealous of. This platform would allow you to experience the tasks in a virtual environment, giving you a deeper understanding of the skills and effort required to complete them.

Time Management Training: Offer a time management training program that teaches you how to prioritize tasks, manage distractions, and stay focused. This program would help you develop the skills necessary to complete tasks efficiently and effectively, reducing the feeling of jealousy towards others.

Task Decomposition: Teach you how to break down complex tasks into smaller, manageable steps. By doing so, you'll be able to focus on one step at a time, making the task feel less daunting and more achievable. This technique can help you avoid feeling overwhelmed and jealous of others who seem to complete tasks with ease.

Accountability Partner: Find an accountability partner who shares your goals and struggles. This person can provide support, encouragement, and motivation to help you stay on track and complete tasks efficiently. By having someone to hold you accountable, you'll be more likely to stay focused and avoid feelings of jealousy towards others.

Mindfulness Practice: Practice mindfulness techniques such as meditation, deep breathing, or yoga to help you stay present and focused. By being more mindful of your thoughts and emotions, you'll be better able to manage feelings of jealousy and stay motivated to complete tasks.
